LightningErrorEventLog.name: LightningErrorEventLog
LightningErrorEventLog.description: Lightning Error events represent errors that occurred during user interactions with Lightning Experience and the Salesforce mobile app.

AppName.description: The name of the application that the user accessed.

BrowserName.description: The name of the browser that the user accessed.

BrowserVersion.description: The version of the browser that the user accessed in major.minor version format. Some browsers don’t provide a minor version.

ClientGeolocation.description: The geolocation of the client in the form of <Country>/<State|Province>.

ClientIp.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”.

ComponentName.description: The internal name of the standard component that generated the error. The Salesforce developer assigned the name when the standard component was created.

DeviceIdentifier.description: The unique identifier used to identify a device when tracking events. DEVICE_ID is a generated value that’s created when the mobile app is initially run after installation.

DeviceModel.description: The name of the device model.

DevicePlatform.description: The type of application experience in name:experience:form format.

DeviceSessionIdentifier.description: The unique identifier of the user’s session based on page load time. If the user reloads a page, it starts a new session.

LoginKey.description: The string that ties together all events in a user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

PageAppName.description: The internal name of the application that the user accessed from the App Launcher.

PageContext.description: Context of the page where the event occurred.

PageStartTime.description: Time when page was initially loaded

PageUrl.description: Relative URL of the top-level Lightning Experience or Salesforce mobile app page that the user opened. The page can contain one or more Lightning components.

PreviousPageUrl.description: The relative URL of the previous Lightning Experience or Salesforce mobile app page that the user opened

RequestIdentifier.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

SdkAppVersion.description: The mobile SDK application version number.

SessionKey.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all events in Lightning Experience within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started.

StackTrace.description: The stack trace contains the location in the code where the error occurred along with the calling frames that led to the error.

UiEventIdentifier.description: ID of the Lightning event type.

UiEventSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of current event since start of session.

UiEventSource.description: Here are some examples of error flags returned in this field. AuraError Error InvalidStateError RangeError ReferenceError SecurityError SyntaxError TypeError unknown

UiEventTimestamp.description: The time at which this event occurred, measured in milliseconds.

UserAgent.description: The numeric code for the type of client used to make the request (for example, browser, application, or API) as a string.

UserIdentifier.description: The 15-character ID of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.

UserType.description: The category of user license of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.
